name: Michael L. Nelson
content: Home:: Michael L. Nelson, Old Dominion University Michael L. Nelson Department of Computer Science Old Dominion University Norfolk VA 23529 +1 757 683 6393 +1 757 683 4900 (f) mln@cs.odu.edu http://www.cs.odu.edu/~mln/ Virginia Modeling, Simulation and Analysis Center (VMASC) 1030 University Blvd. | Suffolk, VA 23435 School of Data Science 222 Central Avenue | Virginia Beach, VA 23462 Research Projects Publications Teaching & Students Service & Awards Personal About Me... I joined the Computer Science department at Old Dominion University in 2002. I worked at NASA Langley Research Center from 1991-2002. Through a NASA fellowship, I spent the 2000-2001 academic year at the School of Information and Library Science, University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. I am active in the Open Archives community and am an editor of the OAI-PMH, OAI-ORE, Memento, and ResourceSync specifications. I have developed many digital libraries, including the NASA Technical Report Server. In 2007 I received an NSF CAREER award. My research interests include web science, repository-object interaction and digital preservation. Further information about me can be found at: CV: Long, Short Academic Lineage Travel Dates ODU Advertisement (regional subscription issues of Time, Newsweek, US News and Sports Illustrated for the week of April 9, 2007) Popular press: Virginian Pilot, CNN, Canada AM, The New Yorker, The Atlantic, The Washington Post, MIT Technology Review, The Chronicle of Higher Education, WHRO, BBC, Der Spiegel, and others about me and my research group Tweets by phonedude_mln
